channel.title: UN News - Global perspective Human stories
channel.description: UN News - Global perspective Human stories | Europe

item.title: ‘Grim milestone’ as Ukraine war reaches 500-day mark
item.description: The UN deplored the horrendous civilian cost of the Russian invasion of Ukraine, which reached the 500-day mark on Friday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: IAEA: Europe’s largest nuclear power plant regains back-up electricity feed
item.description: The Zaporizhzhya Nuclear Power Plant (ZNPP) in Ukraine is now reconnected to its only back-up power line after four months, but the power situation at the site remains “highly vulnerable”, warned Rafael Mariano Grossi, head of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) on Monday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: From the Field: Finding a sanctuary for animals in Ukraine
item.description: Animals left behind by their owners following Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine in February 2022 have been found a new sanctuary, thanks in part to the support of the UN.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Ukraine: Concerns mount over influx of weapons and growing civilian casualties
item.description: The protection of civilians should remain the top priority amid the continued full-scale invasion of Ukraine by Russia, and strict control over weapons supplies is needed to prevent diversion, the UN disarmament chief told the Security Council on Thursday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: WHO: ‘Long COVID’ may obstruct return to normal life for 36 million Europeans
item.description: While no longer a global emergency, COVID-19’s lasting effects alongside such other threats as mpox and seasonal heat waves may still prove challenging for Europe through the summer months, the head of the World Health Organization (WHO) regional office warned on Tuesday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Ukraine’s ‘Wild West’: Rebuilding a ‘new’ Kharkiv during an invasion
item.description: The Ukrainian city of Kharkiv had just survived another missile attack in the spring of 2022 following Russia’s full-scale invasion, when historian, architect, and documentary filmmaker Maxim Rosenfeld stood in the penthouse of a ruined office building, presenting his concept for a new urban landscape after a UN-supported team of international and local architects adopted his vision.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Ukraine: War ‘weakening’ international security, political affairs chief warns
item.description: Since Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine in February 2022, the war “has weakened the international collective security system we have all pledged to uphold”, the top UN political affairs official told the Security Council on Friday, briefing ambassdors on the current situation on the ground.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Agencies join forces with deminers to reclaim agricultural land in Ukraine
item.description: Ukraine’s severely damaged agricultural sector will receive a boost from two UN agencies they announced on Thursday, partnering with a Swiss mine action foundation to help make land safe and productive again amidst the ongoing Russian invasion.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Financial system must evolve in ‘giant leap towards global justice’: Guterres
item.description: Developing countries are buckling under high debt and exorbitant borrowing costs, that prevent them from reviving their economies, UN chief António Guterres said on Thursday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: UN retirees host Ukrainian refugee family
item.description: At a home in the British countryside, two retired UN staff members have hosted a Ukrainian mother and son for more than a year. Ahead of World Refugee Day, the housemates shared their stories and the impact the experience has had on their lives.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Report reveals war’s ‘stark impacts’ on Ukraine society
item.description: Twenty-two percent of households in Ukraine are spending over a quarter of their monthly income on healthcare, according to a report issued on Monday by 12 UN agencies in the country.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Europe warming twice as fast as other continents, warns WMO
item.description: Europe has been warming twice as fast as the global average since the 1980s it was revealed on Monday, with extreme weather causing excess deaths and economic disruption.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Russia declines UN request for aid access to areas flooded by Ukraine dam breach
item.description: A senior United Nations relief official said on Sunday that Russia has so far declined requests to help residents of Russian-controlled areas of southern Ukraine impacted by the breach of the Kakhovka dam.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Ukraine: 700,000 people affected by water shortages from dam disaster
item.description: UN humanitarians continue bringing life-saving aid to survivors of the flooding from the Kakhovka Dam, but they’ve warned that hundreds of thousands more people in the country’s south face severe water shortages.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Mediterranean migrant shipwreck: Swift action needed to prevent new tragedy
item.description: The UN refugee and migration agencies are calling for urgent and decisive action to prevent further deaths at sea following Wednesday’s tragedy in the Mediterranean. With 78 bodies retrieved, 104 people rescued, and hundreds more missing and feared dead, the 14 June shipwreck off the coast of Greece is one of the worst and most deadly in years.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Kakhovka dam disaster a health crisis in the making: WHO
item.description: Disease outbreaks, a mental health crisis and lack of access to care are among the devastating health impacts of the destruction of the Kahkovka dam in southern Ukraine a week ago, the UN World Health Organization (WHO) said on Tuesday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Ukraine: Kakhovka dam aid effort reaches 180,000 people
item.description: Heavy rains and thunderstorms in the area of the Kakhovka dam disaster in southern Ukraine aggravated the humanitarian situation there on Monday, making evacuations and aid distribution harder.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: ‘We stand by you’ declares UN relief chief, outlining emergency plan for Ukraine dam disaster
item.description: Plans to help the people of Ukraine following the destruction of the Kakhovka Dam are centred on saving people “right now”, UN Emergency Relief Coordinator Martin Griffiths told UN News in an interview on Friday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Dam disaster: UN ‘committed to reaching all Ukrainians in need’, says top aid official
item.description: The UN’s top official in Ukraine reassured the country’s Foreign Minister on Thursday that the Organization has been working to provide support and aid to civilians affected by the destruction of the Kakhovka Dam since the first hours of the disaster.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Ukraine dam disaster: Lack of clean water, spread of disease, major risks
item.description: The magnitude of the humanitarian catastrophe following the destruction of the Kakhovka dam in southern Ukraine, is becoming clearer as UN humanitarians redoubled efforts to reach affected civilians with aid on Wednesday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Ukraine: Dam destruction ‘monumental humanitarian, economic and ecological catastrophe’: Guterres
item.description: Tens of thousands of civilians in Ukraine are in danger on the frontline, after the apparent destruction of a huge dam on Tuesday, which the UN chief described as a “monumental humanitarian, economic and environmental catastrophe” resulting directly from Russia’s invasion of the country.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Ukraine: Over 1,500 children killed or injured, concern rises over forced transfers
item.description: With Ukraine’s Children’s Day celebrations on Thursday marred by the death of a girl alongside other civilians in a Russian missile attack in the capital Kyiv, the UN’s top humanitarian official in the country, Denise Brown, said she was “shocked and saddened” by the incident.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: UN commends Criminal Tribunal for former Yugoslavia, as final judgement is delivered
item.description: The UN chief on Wednesday commended the work of the judges and staff of the International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia (ICTY), as its final judgement was delivered, increasing the prison sentences on appeal of two former top Serbian security officials.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Belarus: ‘Unprecedented level of repression’ must end, say UN rights experts
item.description: A large group of UN-appointed independent human rights experts on Tuesday called on the Belarusian authorities to immediately release all those being held on “spurious charges”, simply for exercising their fundamental rights to peaceful assembly, association and expression, to be released without delay.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Ukraine: UN delivers aid to millions, as civilian suffering continues
item.description: Humanitarians reached 5.4 million people in Ukraine with desperately needed aid by April this year, including cash assistance, food, health services, and medicines, the UN said on Friday.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Ukraine: Power loss at nuclear plant underscores ‘highly vulnerable’ safety situation
item.description: The Zaporizhzhya Nuclear Power Plant (ZNPP) in Ukraine lost all external power for several hours on Monday morning, highlighting the urgent need to protect the facility and prevent an accident, the Director General of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) said in a statement.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: IAEA warns of ‘increasingly tense military situation’ around Ukraine nuclear plant
item.description: The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) continues to warn of the potential nuclear threat in the Ukraine conflict amid rising tensions surrounding the Zaporizhzhya Nuclear Power Plant (ZNPP).
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Survey reveals war’s ‘immense’ mental health toll on Ukrainian refugee mothers in Poland
item.description: More than 60 per cent of Ukrainian refugee mothers in Poland are experiencing high or severe levels of distress, the UN Children’s Fund (UNICEF) said on Friday, Mental Health Action Day, highlighting the psychological impact of the war in their homeland.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Ukraine: Imperative to ‘explore all options’ to reach civilians – UN relief chief
item.description: Civilians who are caught up in the crossfire in Ukraine need and deserve humanitarian relief, “wherever the are”, said the UN Humanitarian Affairs chief on Monday, briefing the Security Council, calling for aid workers to be allowed full access, in line with international law.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

item.title: Black Sea Initiative exports top 30 million tonnes from Ukraine, as talks continue over renewal
item.description: The UN-brokered Black Sea Initiative, aimed at ensuring the flow of grain, foodstuffs and fertilizer amid global shortages exacerbated by the war in Ukraine, has now allowed the safe export of more than 30 million tonnes, since it first began in July last year.
item.source: UN News - Global perspective Human stories
